meta.name: Description
meta.content: Grenada School District Home Page, info about Grenada School District

meta.name: viewport
meta.title: Grenada School District Home Page with Site Links

div.h5:
Grenada School District (GSD) students will not return to school for the rest of the second semester.
GSD will pass out the third packet on May 4, 2020 (Monday).
The principals from each school will be sending out an AIMS Web message on packet pick-up information and their statements will be posted on GSD’s website and Facebook page.
The online version should be available on May 4, 2020. The hard copy and online version will contain the same information. GSD’s website and Facebook page gives directions for instructions on locating the online information through clever.com.
Students need to continue working on their packets. Parents and guardians, please encourage your children to work on these packets each day.
GRADUATION:
Graduation for the 2020 school year will be different from the past due to un-precedented circumstances. We are in the process of developing a plan to make graduation appropriate and positive for students and their family members. More information will be provided once the plan has been completed.
Please be patient as we develop a plan for graduation that will not create health risks.
GRADES:
We are encouraging students to continue their educational process by working through the packets of educational materials provided by our district through curbside pick-up and online access.
We are in the process of developing a plan to determine final grades for the end of the school year.
REGISTRATION AND TEACHER REQUEST:
The online registration process must be completed prior to teacher request for the new school year.
Pre-K student’s tuition fee must be paid, and registration completed prior to teacher request.
K-5 students must be registered for teacher request to be honored. The process for teacher request will be sent out at a later date.
GMS students must be registered for teacher request to be honored. The teacher request link is in the online registration process.
GHS student’s course selection process has currently been on-going by email between parents, students, and counselors. The student’s schedules will not be processed until registration is complete.

Grab & Go Meals will continue until further notice. Please check GSD website and GSD Facebook page for updates.
No meals will be served on Friday, April 10 and Monday, April 13 as those days are scheduled holidays. --

br.h5:
Grenada School District (GSD) will pass out the second packet on Friday (April 3,2020) from 11:00-4:30. The principals from each school will be sending out an Aims Web message on pickup information and their statements will be posted on GSD’s website and Facebook page.
The online version will be available early next week. The hard copy and online version will contain the same information. The second packet will contain at least four weeks of work which in some cases will be over 200 pages.
GSD’s website and Facebook page gives directions for instructions on locating the online information through clever.com.
The purpose of the packet is for our students to continue their learning. Parents and guardians please encourage your children to work on assignments daily. Thank you for your support during these unusual times and stay safe.

This is David Daigneault, Superintendent of Grenada School District. In an effort to provide additional ways to support our students, I am pleased to share that instructional packets will be available online or by curbside pickup. On Monday, March 23rd instructional packets for each grade level may be accessed at clever.com, or persons may drive to each individual school to pick up a hard copy. For more instructions for using clever.com, see the instructions beneath this update on this website or facebook.
Please note, these online packets contain a large amount of material, up to 150 pages, that will require printing.
Please understand these packets are optional and will not be graded but are merely our way of providing your child a means of continuing his/her instruction.
Administrators and Teachers continue working tirelessly to provide an uninterrupted education for the 2019-2020 school year. During this unprecedented time, we want to work together with parents to provide Grenada’s children the best education possible. Together we will get through this, and our children will continue to thrive even in the most difficult of times

*to use the Clever website, use the address clever.com/in/grenadak12
*the username should be the student’s email address
*the password should be the student ID
*after you have accessed the site, click on “Google Drive”
*then click on “shared with me”
Instructions for accessing clever.com may also be found in your ActiveParent account under
“Demographics"

img.alt: photo of entrance of GES Red Top

div.h6:
Grades Pre-K-3;
GES Red Top has been recognized by Business Week Magazine as the Number One Rural School in America. GES houses "The Kidzeum," the first school-based children's museum in the US.

img.alt: photo of the entrance of Grenada Elementary Green Top

div.h6:
Grades 4-5;
At Grenada Elementary Green Top, we offer our students optimum learning experiences. In the Discovery Lab, our hands-on science lab, the instruction includes activities, experiments, and the latest advances in technology.

Grades 6-8;
Basic, supplementary, and remedial courses enable every student to excel. The walls have been transformed into teaching tools through the use of timelines, sculptures, and paintings in Walls That Teach.

Grades 9-12;
General, pre-college, and technological needs are met with a broad range of concentrated instruction in preparation for the global world. GHS also boasts award-winning band, Visions, and NNDCC programs for the pursuit of artistic goals.
GCTC provides sequenced programs designed to prepare students for entry-level employment or further specialty study.

img.alt: photo of entrance of Grenada Enrichment and Transition Center

div.h6: GETC houses Alternative Education(for modification of behavior) and GED Program (preparation for the GED test).

br.h5: Grenada School District has created an outdoor WiFi hotspot in the Grenada High School Parking lot. The purpose of this is to allow students and parents who do not have internet access at home to have access to packets and educational resources. The WiFi will be available in the Grenada High School parking lot during the hours of 6:30 AM to 7:30 PM. However, you must stay in your personal vehicle, avoid contact with others, and practice social distancing.

a.br: All MHSAA competition and practice suspended through April 17, 2020

br.h5:
GES 4-5 Grenada Elementary School 4-5 (Green Top Building) will have enrichment packets ready to be picked up from 11:00-4:00 on Monday, March 23. Parents will use the circle drive in the front of the building for pickup.
Carol Tharpe
Grenada Elementary School

Grenada Elementary School PreK-3rd Grade (Red Top Building) will have enrichment packets ready to be picked up from 11:00-4:00 on Monday, March 23. Parents will use the circle drive in the front of the building for pickup.
Cole Surrell
Grenada Elementary School

March 20, 2020
Good afternoon, this is Marshall Whittemore, Principal, at Grenada Middle School.
I hope this message finds everyone well. Grenada Middle School will give out student work on Monday March 23, 2020 from 11 AM to 4 PM. Pick up will take place in the circle drive at Grenada Middle School. Staff will be stationed in the circle drive with 6th -8th grade packets. When you drive up please give the students name and grade. The packets will cover two weeks of work for math, ELA, and science. Packets will also include Social Studies for 7th and 8th grade.
We are planning on a second pickup date of April 6, 2020 from 11 AM to 4 PM for two additional weeks of work. You will be notified if there are any changes or updates.
Please know that we will do everything in our power to continue to educate our children. Thank you for your patience and continued support.
Thanks again,
Marshall Whittemore

br.a: View previous issues of the Communicator

td.h5:
For the 2020-2021 school year, Grenada School District is offering a pre-kindergarten program for three and four-year-old children.
Applications can be picked up at Grenada Elementary School or Central Office or printed from the GSD website.
Applications will be accepted at GES.
Application deadline is Friday, February 28, 2020, at 3:00 P.M.

The Grenada High School Marching Band won their 72nd Grand Championship at the Gibson County Marching Invitational in Tennessee recently. The contest included bands from Tennessee, Mississippi, and Kentucky. The show, called "Erendira - Warrior Princess" is an intricate blend of musical interpretation.

Visions sang and danced their way to another grand championship at Jackson Prepatory School, winning titles of Overall Grand Champion, Best Show Design, Best Vocals, Best Visuals, and First Place Large Division.

At the January meeting of the GSD Board of Trustees, Kevin Carnathan was sworn in as the new board president, filling the seat previously held by Brent Brasher.
Also sworn in was Haley Biddy, the board's newest member. The Biddy family has been well-represented in GSD for many years. Haley's father, Bobby Biddy, is a renowned carpenter with the district's maintenance department, and his sister, Kim Graves, is a counselor as GES PreK-3.
Haley's grandfather, Brigadier General James Harold Biddy, served as a member of the GSD Board from 1965 to 1976. He was instrumental in planning for the Grenada National Guard Armory to be turned over to the school district when operations were completed.

available for grades 6-12- Tutoring and Skills classes include Podcasting/Music Production, Photoshop/Media Design, Pottery/Ceramics, Urban Agriculture/Archery, Weightlifting/Law Enforcement, Building Trades (9-12 only), Automotive/Welding (9-12 only), and Culinary Arts (9-12 only). (Principals will select ALL tutoring and Weightlifting/Law Enforcement students.) All classes will include free snacks and bus transportation home.For info, contact GMS or GHS principal or call the Parent Center at 227-3370. (If your class fills up, we will put you on a waiting list.) SIGN UP TODAY!!!!!

td.h3: Grenada Association of Educators Honors Legislator
td.h5: The Grenada Association of Educators(GAE) recently hosted a Legislative Reception to honor our legislator Kevin Horan that continues to standup and speak out for public education. (l to r) Superintendent Dr. David Daigneault, Legislator Kevin Horan, and GAE President Suzanne Smith.

div.p: Follow our District on facebook, Instagram, twitter, YouTube, and our monthly newspaper, The Communicator.

br.h5:
Grenada School District is dedicated to excellence so that each child reaches their maximum potential within a safe learning environment while providing a comprehensive educational program that fosters the academic, physical, social, and emotional growth of all students.
More info.
We are committed to making our website accessible to all visitors, including those with disabilities.

Box 1940, Grenada, MS 38902-1940, (662) 226-1606, have been designated to handle inquiries and complaints regarding the non-discrimination policies of the Grenada School District. The Grenada School District is an equal employment employer.
